item.title: Cabinet: Pulau Kukup's status as a national park must be retained - Malaysiakini
item.description:
Malaysiakini

Pulau Kukup's status as a Johor national park must be retained, the cabinet has decided. "(This is) to ensure that it stays as the world's second largest uninhabited mangrove island," Water, Land, and Natural Resources Minister Dr Xavier Jayakumar said in a statement. Pulau Kukup is one of the few remaining pristine wetlands in Southeast Asia and is one of five Ramsar sites in Malaysia. Ramsar sites are wetland sites designated to be of international importance under the United Nations Convention on Wetlands. Xavier said any change to Pulau Kukup's status "could impact its recognition" as a...

item.title: Honda 3S outlet opens in Pasir Gudang, Johor - Carsifu
item.description:
Honda 3S outlet opens in Pasir Gudang, Johor  Carsifu

JOHOR BARU: Honda Malaysia has announced the opening of its 97th dealership in Pasir Gudang near here. The 3S centre is operated by dealer Yong Ming Motor Sdn. Bhd and is the 12th Honda dealership in the state. The newest Honda dealership offers 14 service bays that can cater to 30 cars daily. Typical facilities of such dealerships are the availability of a customer lounge, children’s play area and a prayer room. Honda Malaysia said Yong Ming Motor had invested RM18.5mil into the 77,000-square foot building. Yong Ming Motor has been a Honda dealer for over 48 years and the Pasir Gudang outl...

item.title: MB World to launch three projects in Iskandar Malaysia - The Star Online
item.description:
MB World to launch three projects in Iskandar Malaysia  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: MB World Group Berhad (MBWG) is upbeat on the property outlook and prospects in Iskandar Malaysia and will launch three new property projects in the country’s first economic growth corridor next year. “Demand for residential properties is still encouraging in Iskandar Malaysia and we have the right products to cater to our prospective buyers,” said MBWG executive director Ng Liang Khiang, adding that demand for residential properties there would be further driven by the influx of domestic and foreign investors and new residents in south Johor. He said the three projects to be la...

item.title: Enjoy the festive season - The Star Online
item.description:
Enjoy the festive season  The Star Online

A 10-Year success story, Kluang Mall has made the Kluang district a regional shopping destination. Welcoming Year 10 in style, Kluang Mall offers a place where families can shop, dine, be entertained and enjoy life. The 76,180sq m (820,000sq ft) mall owned by Majupadu Development Sdn Bhd led to a retail explosion in the area, including neighbouring districts to become the catalyst and the leading shopping mall in Central Johor. Teenagers shopping for back-to-school outfits in the Kluang community retail corridor have no knowledge of what it was like before Kluang Mall opened on the eve of C...

item.title: Pulau Kukup to keep national park status - The Star Online
item.description:
Pulau Kukup to keep national park status  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Pulau Kukup, said to be among the biggest uninhabited mangrove forests in the world, will remain a national park following confirmation from the Johor palace. The state assembly also app­roved an emergency motion yesterday, saying that the national park status should be maintained for environmental preservation. Pulau Kukup, which is about one kilometre away from the mainland near Pontian, came under the spotlight when a gazette dated Oct 25 about the state authorities cancelling its status as a protected national park went viral on social media. Yesterday, Tunku Mahkota Johor T...

item.title: TMJ: Why politicise Pulau Kukup’s national park status? - The Star Online
item.description:
TMJ: Why politicise Pulau Kukup’s national park status?  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Tunku Mahkota Johor Tunku Ismail Ibni Sultan Ibrahim (pic) says he does not understand why the status of Pulau Kukup as a national park is being “politicised”. “I do not understand why this issue has to be blown up and politicised as land matters are the prerogative of state government," he tweeted late on Wednesday nights (Dec 5). “I am confident that any decision by Sultan Ibrahim Sultan Iskandar and the Johor government was in the best interest and sovereignty of Johor.” He was replying to Twitter user @TheDukeofKL, who told him to claim Malaysia’s victory over Thailand in...

item.title: Singapore lodges ‘strong protest’ over extension of Johor Bahru port limits - Malaysia Today
item.description:
Singapore lodges ‘strong protest’ over extension of Johor Bahru port limits  Malaysia Today

(CNA) – Singapore has lodged a “strong protest” with the Malaysian government over its move to extend the Johor Bahru port limits “in a manner which encroaches into Singapore’s territorial waters off Tuas”, said Singapore’s Ministry of Transport (MOT) in a media statement on Tuesday (Dec 4). Changes to the port limits were announced through Malaysia’s Federal Government Gazette on Oct 25, 2018, in a document published by the Attorney General’s Chambers. Singapore said it has requested that Malaysia refrain from taking any further unilateral action, and to amend the gazette notification “to ...

item.title: Johor govt needs to further discuss degazetting of Pulau Kukup - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor govt needs to further discuss degazetting of Pulau Kukup  The Star Online

The Johor legislative assembly on Thursday passed an emergency motion on the degazetting of Pulau Kukup as a national park. That means the state executive council will need to further discuss the matter as there are concerns that the degazetting of the national park in Pontian will not help protect the attraction.

item.title: Quality homes with affordable pricing in JB - The Star Online
item.description:
Quality homes with affordable pricing in JB  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Developer Mah Sing Group Berhad (Mah Sing) has officially launched its latest project at Meridin East township, the Hazel, with a total gross development value (GDV) of RM5bil. Measuring 20’ by 70’ and with a built-up area of 1,964 square feet, Hazel offers residents a spacious layout with four bedrooms and three bathrooms, which is optimised for multi-generational living. Situated in a well-planned sustainable township and gated and guarded community, Hazel is priced from RM487,000, meeting the market demand for quality homes with affordable pricing. Mah Sing chief executive of...

item.title: Singapore makes its point after Malaysia wants to take back management of airspace over south Johor - The Star Online
item.description:
Singapore makes its point after Malaysia wants to take back management of airspace over south Johor  The Star Online

SINGAPORE (The Straits Times/Asia News Network): The Ministry of Transport (MOT) has rejected the contention that Malaysia's sovereignty is compromised in any manner because Singapore provides air traffic services over south Johor. This came after Malaysia said that it wants to take back the management of airspace over south Johor that it has delegated to Singapore after protesting against new flight paths proposed over Seletar Airport. "Singapore respects Malaysia's sovereignty," said the MOT on Tuesday (Dec 4). "At the same time international law is clear that cross-border airspace manag...

item.title: Pakatan blames BN for de-gazetting Pulau Kukup - The Star Online
item.description:
Pakatan blames BN for de-gazetting Pulau Kukup  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: The Pakatan Harapan-led Johor government has blamed the previous Barisan Nasional administration for de-gazetting Pulau Kukup as a national park. State senior executive committee member Aminolhuda Hassan claimed that the current administration had no knowledge of it. “We do not know about this because the approval came during an exco meeting by the previous administration held in March. “We only knew about this after a decision had been made and approved,” he said when met outside the state assembly which was held at Bangunan Sultan Ismail here yesterday. Meanwhile, in a tweet, ...

item.title: Malaysia not opposed to development of Seletar Airport, says Transport Minister - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia not opposed to development of Seletar Airport, says Transport Minister  The Star Online

PUTRAJAYA: Malaysia is not against the development of Singapore's Seletar Airport, says Transport Minister Anthony Loke. He, however, added that Malaysia opposes the use of the airspace above Pasir Gudang in Johor. Loke said that Singapore had every right to develop the Seletar Airport as it is built within their territory. “I would like to stress that we have nothing against Seletar Airport. Our opposition is only towards the ILS (Instrument Landing System) above Pasir Gudang. “If they want to develop the airport and the flight path is over Singapore airspace, then that has nothing to do w...

item.title: Top lion dance troupe to host tourney in Muar - The Star Online
item.description:
Top lion dance troupe to host tourney in Muar  The Star Online

In conjunction with its 30th anniversary, the award-winning Kun Seng Keng Lion and Dragon Dance Association will be having a Bandar diRaja Immeri Cup 2018 Inter-national Invitation Tournament in Muar, Johor, this month. The tournament will be held on Dec 27, followed by the gala dinner on Dec 28. The world lion dance champion from Muar has won 73 international tournaments and 81 national tournaments. At a press conference in Da Men Mall in Subang Jaya, its chief troupe leader Tan Chong Hing said Immeri International will be the association’s patron for three years, and will sponsor the upco...

item.title: Please rethink de-gazetting of Pulau Kukup - The Star Online
item.description:
Please rethink de-gazetting of Pulau Kukup  The Star Online

I REFER to the report “Pulau Kukup may lose its status” (The Star, Dec 5) on the Johor state government’s de-gazetting of the status of Pulau Kukup as a national park. This area is the second largest mangrove island in the world. We can build the second largest hotel or even the second largest oil refinery in the world but there is one thing we can never build or even create – the second largest pristine mangrove island in the world. Mangroves forests have evolved to thrive in flooded coastal areas over hundreds of years. As a unique natural resource, mangroves, among others, protect coastl...

item.title: Johor Sultan commends JCorp for its achievements in helping to develop state - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor Sultan commends JCorp for its achievements in helping to develop state  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: State Ruler Sultan Ibrahim Ibni Almarhum Sultan Iskandar has praised Johor Corporation (JCorp) for its continuous effort in developing the state through all of its big projects. Sultan Ibrahim said JCorp should also be appreciated for carrying out various corporate social responsibility programmes that had touched all walks of life. “Today, we are able to see JCorp’s flowering achievements such as the Johor Bahru City Centre, Pasir Gudang Township, Dato Onn Housing Project, Industrial Park, Kulim Plantation, KPJ Hospitals and many others. “After 50 years of endless efforts, we a...

item.title: Saddened by racial intolerance, Johor Permaisuri shares family's interracial relations - The Star Online
item.description:
Saddened by racial intolerance, Johor Permaisuri shares family's interracial relations  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The Permaisuri of Johor, Raja Zarith Sofiah Sultan Idris Shah has expressed her sadness over the racial intolerance and misunderstanding that has blighted the nation following the recent rioting at the Seafield Sri Maha Mariamman Temple in Subang Jaya. In a post on her personal Facebook page, she shared a reminder of the warm friendship her family has had over the years with four Malaysian Indian men. She credits the family doctors Datuk Dr Subrahmanyam Balan and Datuk Dr N. Singaraveloo as they “were part of the medical team who helped look after my late son, Tunku Abdul Jal...

item.title: Johor Sultan advises JCorp CEO, board to ensure performance is on track - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor Sultan advises JCorp CEO, board to ensure performance is on track  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Johor Ruler Sultan Ibrahim Ibni Almarhum Sultan Iskandar has reminded the Johor Corporation (JCorp) chief executive officer (CEO) and board of directors (BOD) to perform their duties well. Sultan Ibrahim said failing to do so, they could be replaced, adding that his duty was to ensure the state investment arm performs well and is on the right track. The Sultan pointed out that he has the power to appoint the CEO and the BOD under the Johor Corporation Enactment 4, 1968. "However, it doesn't mean that I'm interfering with the administration and my presence is to ensure there is a...

item.title: Electronics brand opens its first Batu Pahat outlet - The Star Online
item.description:
Electronics brand opens its first Batu Pahat outlet  The Star Online

LG ELECTRONICS Malaysia opened its first brand shop in Batu Pahat district and sixth outlet in Johor, offering consumers a wide range of home entertainment and electrical appliances. Managing director Kim Kyu Tae said among the products available at the Batu Pahat store included its OLED TVs, UHD, HD and LED TVs, soundbar, refrigerators, signature washers and DUALCOOL air-conditioners. “We are committed to delivering a holistic and positive experience to our consumers when using our products and we are constantly seeking new methods to introduce innovative and sophisticated products to them...

item.title: Come clean on RM200,000 allocation for Pakatan lawmakers, urges Johor MCA Youth - The Star Online
item.description:
Come clean on RM200,000 allocation for Pakatan lawmakers, urges Johor MCA Youth  The Star Online

PONTIAN: Johor MCA Youth wants the state government to come clean on the RM200,000 allocation given to Pakatan Harapan lawmakers for their constituencies. Its chief Ling Tian Soon claimed Johor MCA Youth had received feedback from the community and non-governmental organisations (NGOs) that the allocation was no longer available for them. "The money should be disbursed for the local community and NGOs but it didn't reach them," he told reporters in a press conference at Tanjung Piai MCA division office here on Sunday (Nov 18). Ling said when approached by their constituents and NGOs for fin...

item.title: A symbol of rich heritage - The Star Online
item.description:
A symbol of rich heritage  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: The Heritage Cornerstone is the second of four key cornerstones to be unveiled within Ibrahim International Business District (IIBD) to represent the rich heritage of Johor. The 6.70m Heritage Cornerstone erected at Legaran Segget celebrates Johor’s diverse cultural legacy via a local traditional design of an Urban Tree. It is made up of three metal branches that extend upwards and outwards to form a broad leaf that symbolises the three main ethnic groups in Johor. The tree’s broad leaves also reveal various pattern cut-outs inspired by cultural motifs found on existing heritage...

item.title: Johor MB: Crooked bridge's design may straighten out - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor MB: Crooked bridge's design may straighten out  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: The design for the proposed "crooked bridge" to replace the 95-year-old Johor-Singapore Causeway has not been finalised and could be different from what was originally envisioned, says Johor Mentri Besar Datuk Osman Sapian. He said that there was a possibility that the project, which was shelved by the Barisan Nasional government back in 2006, might begin in 2019. "The construction might take place next year and it may or may not be crooked as we have yet to finalise the design. "We are not looking for glamour from the project but want to make it into a reality," he said when me...

item.title: Iskandar Malaysia attracts RM273b investments - The Star Online
item.description:
Iskandar Malaysia attracts RM273b investments  The Star Online

JOHOR BAHRU: Iskandar Malaysia recorded investments totalling RM19.8 billion in the first nine months of this year, raising the cumulative investments committed since 2006 to RM272.90 billion. In a statement today, Iskandar Regional Development Authority Chief Executive Datuk Ismail Ibrahim said despite the current global challenges, Iskandar Malaysia was optimistic and on track to achieve its investment target for 2018. “As Iskandar Malaysia sails through its third development phase (2016 – 2025) focusing on sustainability and innovation, the region's inflow of investments from domestic an...

item.title: Johor princess visits comedian Zaibo who is battling with cancer - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor princess visits comedian Zaibo who is battling with cancer  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Johor princess Tunku Tun Aminah Maimunah Iskandariah binti Sultan Ibrahim paid a visit to veteran actor and comedian Zainal Ariffin Abdul Hamid or better known as Zaibo, who is battling with cancer. In a Facebook post on The Royal Johor on Monday, Tunku Aminah was accompanied by her husband Dennis Muhammad Abdullah as well as representatives from The Tunku Laksamana Johor Cancer Foundation at Zaibo’s residence in Rengit, Batu Pahat. The princess was moved after reading about his plight and decided to personally visit and encourage him in his struggle against cancer. Zaibo, 62...

item.title: Teen slashed to death, another seriously injured in attack at Johor school carnival - The Star Online
item.description:
Teen slashed to death, another seriously injured in attack at Johor school carnival  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: A teenager was killed while another suffered serious injuries during a brazen attack in broad daylight at a school in Skudai here. The incident happened at around 1pm on Sunday during a carnival at the school where the victims were former students. One of the victims died due to serious slash wounds while another victim is in critical condition and has been sent to Sultanah Aminah Hospital here. Deputy Education Minister Teo Nie Ching has just arrived at the scene of the crime where she is meeting with the school authorities and the police including Johor Baru North OCPD Asst Co...

item.title: Saving the mangrove ecosystem in Johor - The Star Online
item.description:
Saving the mangrove ecosystem in Johor  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Some 250 volunteers planted 1,020 mangrove saplings in Pulau Tanjung Surat to raise awareness of the mangrove ecosystem and its contribution to the local socio-economy. The event was organised by the Global Environmental Centre (GEC) in collaboration with Saudi Aramco, Johor State Forestry Department, Limbongan Maju Sdn Bhd and Pengerang Local Authority, in conjunction with the International Day for the Conservation of the Mangrove Ecosystem. Among the highlights of the event was the launch of a group called Friends of Tanjung Surat Mangrove Forest (FTSMF) that would act as the ...

item.title: Home ownership made easy - The Star Online
item.description:
Home ownership made easy  The Star Online

STAYING true to its principle as a responsible town-maker, Gamuda Land launched GL HOME, a campaign that offers one-stop tailored solutions to help people buy their dream property with ease. GL HOME stands for Gamuda Land’s Home Ownership Made Easy, representing another innovative move by the developer in light of current market conditions. Running until Dec 31, the campaign addresses real needs of property owners, helping them to navigate through various financing options to bridge the differential sum between purchase price and purchaser’s end financing loan amount. “The ever-changing lan...

item.title: Negri, Melaka to be next for joint IWK-water billing initiative - The Star Online
item.description:
Negri, Melaka to be next for joint IWK-water billing initiative  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: The joint-billing for water supply and sewerage services in Johor will also see Indah Water Konsortium (IWK) engaging with Negri Sembilan and Melaka state operators next. IWK chief executive officer Faizal Othman said the joint-billing effort is an extension of their commitment to provide the highest level of service to their customers. "Not only will this effort improve efficiencies, but it will also benefit our customers in facilitating ease of payment by providing a single point of contact. Moving forward, IWK aims to implement joint-billing with other state operators as w...

item.title: Johor budget finalised for tabling - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor budget finalised for tabling  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: The state government has finalised the state budget for next year and it will be tabled at the state legislative assembly on Nov 29. Mentri Besar Datuk Osman Sapian said it would be a people’s budget with the main objective of providing the necessary assistance to all segments of society. He said the state government thanked the people for giving their valuable input and feedback on the state budget. “Like the national budget tabled at Parliament on Nov 2, this will be the maiden budget for Johor Pakatan Harapan after winning the general election,” Osman told reporters after att...

item.title: Johor launches i-Psychology system - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor launches i-Psychology system  The Star Online

ISKANDAR PUTERI: Johor Mentri Besar Datuk Osman Sapian launched the i-Psychology system, an online mental health screening tool to be used on civil servants in the state. He said it was important to assess the mental health of civil servants and the public because psychological stress at the workplace, living conditions and family background could help identify an individual’s strengths and weaknesses. “In addition, he said it was also important to determine how an individual reacts and adapts to situations. “This psychological testing, assessment and counselling will be able to evaluate a ...

item.title: Johor MB: State budget to benefit all regions not just Iskandar Malaysia - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor MB: State budget to benefit all regions not just Iskandar Malaysia  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: The state government has finalised its budget for next year and it will be tabled at the State Legislative Assembly on Nov 29. Mentri Besar Datuk Osman Sapian said it would be a people's budget with the main objective being to provide the necessary assistance to all segments of the society. Osman said the upcoming budget would bring developments to all parts of Johor instead of just focusing on a certain region in the state namely Iskandar Malaysia. He said all districts in Johor have their own strengths adding that the state government wanted to boost development in the respect...

item.title: Johor folk to receive single water services bill next year - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor folk to receive single water services bill next year  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Ranhill SAJ Sdn Bhd (SAJ) and Indah Water Konsortium Sdn Bhd (IWK) have signed a joint billing agreement for water supply and sewerage services in Johor. Under the agreement, consumers will receive a joint bill issued by SAJ listing the charges for both water supply and sewerage services. From 2019 onwards, all bill-related matters will be referred to SAJ while operational matters will still be directed to both entities. SAJ is the subsidiary of Ranhill Holdings Bhd. Ranhill Holdings president and chief executive Tan Sri Hamdan Mohamad said SAJ was pleased to launch the integrat...

item.title: Johor hopeful S'pore checkpoint will also abolish toll for motorcyclists - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor hopeful S'pore checkpoint will also abolish toll for motorcyclists  The Star Online

KULAI: Johor hopes Singapore will follow Malaysia's lead and abolish toll payments for motorcyclists at its Tuas checkpoint effective January next year. State International Trade, Investment and Utilitues Committee chairman Jimmy Puah Wee Tse said such a move by the island republic would be in line with Malaysia's decision to abolish toll for motorcyclists using the Second Link Crossing in Tanjung Kupang, Gelang Patah. "We believe the Singapore government will follow suit, like when tolls at the Eastern Dispersal Link near the Johor Causeway were abolished," he said after presenting Deepava...

item.title: Criticism over affordable homes not constructive, says MB - The Star Online
item.description:
Criticism over affordable homes not constructive, says MB  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: The state government has lambasted the Opposition for always finding fault with efforts introduced by the state government to benefit Bangsa Johor. “They have no issue or rather have so much free time to criticise us,” said Mentri Besar Datuk Osman Sapian. He said this in response to a comment on Johor Umno Youth questioning the move by the state government to introduce the new category of Rumah Mampu Milik Johor (RMMJ) at RM250,000. It alleged that the latest move by the state government was against the policy by the previous Barisan Nasional state government where the pricing ...

item.title: M’sia-S’pore third bridge proposal to be discussed next month - Malaysia Today
item.description:
M’sia-S’pore third bridge proposal to be discussed next month  Malaysia Today

(Bernama) – The proposal to build a third bridge linking Johor to Singapore will be discussed by the Johor government in the Malaysia-Singapore joint ministerial committee (JMC) meeting in Singapore next month. Johor Menteri Besar Osman Sapian, who confirmed this, however, said the discussions would be held with Prime Minister Dr Mahathir Mohamad at the East Coast Economic Region Corridor (ECER) development meeting in Kuala Lumpur today. “It is important to solve the problem of traffic congestion experienced by Johor at this juncture. “If something is not done now, I think it will never eve...

item.title: Special fund set up in Johor - The Star Online
item.description:
Special fund set up in Johor  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: The state government has set up a RM20mil special disaster fund (TBK) to channel financial aid to victims of natural disasters in Johor. Mentri Besar Datuk Osman Sapian said the money would be utilised as a contingency measure while waiting for disbursement of financial aid from the state Welfare Department (JKM). “The decision to set up TBK was made during the executive council meeting,” he said after visiting a carnival at Angsana Mall Johor Baru here. Osman said the state government was aware of the predicaments faced by victims of natural disasters. “They need immediate fina...

item.title: Landfill woes in Simpang Renggam - The Star Online
item.description:
Landfill woes in Simpang Renggam  The Star Online

SIMPANG RENGGAM: Residents here have had enough and do not want to see more rubbish dumped at the district’s sanitary landfill any more. Simpang Renggam MP Dr Maszlee Malik said residents have suffered for the past decade, with no action taken by the previous state government to resolve the problem. “It was all talk and no action in the past and Simpang Renggam residents continued to suffer in silence. It was unfair to them,’’ he said during a closed-door meeting with local leaders and stakeholders handling water and rubbish-related issues at the Simpang Renggam Pakatan Harapan parliament s...

item.title: Johor to woo Airbus to set up MRO operations in the state - The Star Online
item.description:
Johor to woo Airbus to set up MRO operations in the state  The Star Online

KULAI: Johor wants to entice one of the world’s leading aerospace corporation, Airbus, to have its commercial planes maintenance, repair and overhaul (MRO) operations here. State International Trade, Investment and Utilities Committee chairman Jimmy Puah Wee Tse said that the trip was under the Malaysian Investment Development Authority (Mida) to European countries such as Italy, France and Germany. He added that the meeting was organised by Malaysia-France Chamber of Commerce where they would meet Airbus officials in Paris as well as visit their plant in Toulouse and their aerospace indust...

item.title: Consortium to invest RM10bil in PIPC next year - The Star Online
item.description:
Consortium to invest RM10bil in PIPC next year  The Star Online

KULAI: The on-going multibillion ringgit Pengerang Integrated Petroleum Complex (PIPC) continues to attract strong interest from domestic and foreign players in the oil and gas (O&G) sector. Johor International Trade, Investment and Utilities Committee chairman Jimmy Puah Wee Tse said it would receive a major investment of estimated at RM10bil early next year. “The investment comes from a consortium of few countries involved in the O&G related activities,’’ he told a press conference last Saturday. Puah, who is also Bukit Batu assemblyman, said this after presenting Deepavali hampers to 100...

item.title: Outlook for ports in Johor seen bright on Iskandar Malaysia development - The Star Online
item.description:
Outlook for ports in Johor seen bright on Iskandar Malaysia development  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: The prospects of port operations in Johor are bright in the coming years with progress and development taking place in the southernmost part of the state. Johor Port Authority (JPA) general manager Muhammad Razif Ahmad said Iskandar Malaysia, which is located in southern Johor would continue to drive economic activities in the economic growth corridor. He said Iskandar Malaysia would boost logistics and halal sectors in the southern part of Johor which offered good growth prospects for operators of Johor Port and Port of Tanjung Pelepas (PTP). “We together with other stakeholder...

item.title: Bangladeshi killed in mishap - The Star Online
item.description:
Bangladeshi killed in mishap  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: A Bangladeshi construction worker was killed when part of a bridge being built in Jalan Pengerang, Kota Tinggi, near here collapsed. The 42-year-old victim was doing construction work with other workers at about 9am yesterday. Bandar Penawar Fire and Rescue station operations officer, Azlan Mohd Sobberi when contacted by Bernama, said eight personnel were deployed to the scene upon receiving a report. According to him, it took them about 20 minutes to remove the body from the rubble before handing it over to the police for further action. Various parties, including the Public Wo...

item.title: Three fish farmers in Yong Peng guilty of enslaving 12 Indonesian - The Star Online
item.description:
Three fish farmers in Yong Peng guilty of enslaving 12 Indonesian  The Star Online

BATU PAHAT: Three arowana fish farmers have been found guilty of forcing 12 Indonesians to work virtually as slaves. The workers were all kept at a fish farm in Yong Peng, Johor and not allowed to leave the premises, not paid their salaries, not given holidays and not allowed to leave after their contract expired after two years. Three fish farmers were each sentenced to five years' jail and also fined RM60,000 each for 12 counts of human trafficking. Sessions Court judge Amran Jantan meted out the sentence on Sim Kai Chyuan, 35, Bang Lai Seng, 49, and a third businessman who is still at l...

item.title: Proud moment for NUMed graduates - The Star Online
item.description:
Proud moment for NUMed graduates  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: It was a proud moment for 107 graduates of Newcastle University Medicine Malaysia (NUMed) as they received their scrolls at the university’s 5th graduation ceremony. A total of 100 graduates were awarded with Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery (MBBS) while seven others received their Bachelor of Science (Hons) in Biomedical Sciences during the ceremony. The graduation ceremony held at Persada Convention Centre Johor Baru was presided by vice-chancellor and president of Newcastle University Prof Chris Day. Prof Chris said NUMed graduates have a unique identity and a set...

item.title: Businesses welcome move to revive growth triangle - The Star Online
item.description:
Businesses welcome move to revive growth triangle  The Star Online

JOHOR BARU: Business organisations have welcomed the decision by the state government to review and revive the Singapore-Johor-Riau (SIJORI) Growth Triangle. Johor South SME advisor Teh Kee Sin said the move was good as it would stimulate and boost business and economic activities within the growth triangle. “I believe our neighbours Singapore and Indonesia will also be happy to see the revival of SIJORI as it will benefit the three areas within the growth triangle,’’ he said. Teh added that Johor-based small and medium enterprises could tap the collaboration to promote their products, espe...
